alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 04 at 3:59PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Heath Creek near Armuchee affecting Floyd County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Heath Creek near Armuchee. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9 feet, Minor flooding continues of the woodlands and fields along the creek downstream from the Rocky Mountain Lower Reservoir main dam. The shallow Texas Valley Road bridge around two and one half miles downstream from the dam will be flooded with water around one foot deep. Residents will need to take an alternative route. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 8.9 feet, and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM EDT Sunday was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
